title: Conclusion for test of cinnamon on blood glucose

content.prompt: For people similar to those in the study, do the data provide convincing statistical evidence that the proportion who would be classified as normal after one month of taking cinnamon is greater than the proportion who would be classified as normal after one month of not taking cinnamon?

choices.label: No conclusion can be made about the use of cinnamon because the people in the study were volunteers.
There is convincing statistical evidence at the level of 0.01.
There is convincing statistical evidence at the level of 0.05 but not at the level of 0.01.
There is convincing statistical evidence at the level of 0.10 but not at the level of 0.05.
There is not convincing statistical evidence at any reasonable significance level.

topic.text: 6.11: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
